metadata.title: CVE-2018-7170 on Ubuntu 20.04 FIPS Certified (focal) - low
metadata.description:
ntpd in ntp 4.2.x before 4.2.8p7 and 4.3.x before 4.3.92 allowsauthenticated users that know the private symmetric key to createarbitrarily-many ephemeral associations in order to win the clock selectionof ntpd and modify a victim's clock via a Sybil attack. This issue existsbecause of an incomplete fix for CVE-2016-1549.

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2018-7170` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

ntp - 1:4.2.8p11+dfsg-1ubuntu1
ntpdate - 1:4.2.8p11+dfsg-1ubuntu1
sntp - 1:4.2.8p11+dfsg-1ubuntu1
No subscription required

criterions.comment: ntp package in focal was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '1:4.2.8p11+dfsg-1ubuntu1').
